their retinues. 
That same day a council of war had been held in which all the members of the Hof- kriegsrath and both Emperors took part. At that council, contrary to the views of the old generals Kutiizov and Prince Schwartzenberg, it had been decided to advance immediately and give battle to Bonaparte. The council of war was just over when Prince Andrew accom- panied by Boris arrived at the palace to find Dolgorukov. Everyone at headquarters was still under the spell of the day's
